summary: Build request was to publish the current version with no functional/UI changes. The diff includes backend functional changes (user profile storage/endpoints and related authorization checks) and adds new project/deployment documentation/metadata files, which goes beyond “publish only.”

missing_requirements.requirement: Build and publish the current application version without making additional functional changes.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows functional backend changes (new user profile types/state and new query/shared methods) rather than a no-change publish-only update, so the requirement of “no additional functional changes” is not met by the implementation shown.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile feature added/modified in backend (UserProfile type, userProfiles map, get/save profile endpoints with authorization checks).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; BuildRequest explicitly constrains to publish-only with no additional functional changes and lists adding backend data fields/migrations as a non-goal.
Not requested as part of publish-only requirement; represents additional scope beyond “publish the current state only.”

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated internal project state tracking indicating a new feature request entry.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not part of publishing the current version; introduces new metadata/state management content unrelated to deployment-only requirement.
